qas.question: When in the 19th century was the US navy modernized?
What replaced the older sailing ships in the navy?
By what name was the US fleet known at the start of the 20th Century?
Who ordered this fleet to sail around the world?
What was the purpose of this order?

answers.text: to demonstrate the Navy's capability to extend to the global theater

qas.question: When in the 19th century was the UK navy modernized?
What replaced the younger sailing ships in the navy?
By what name was the US fleet known at the start of the 21st Century?
Who wouldn't let this fleet to sail around the world?

plausible_answers.text: demonstrate the Navy's capability to extend to the global theater

qas.question: What was the purpose of this order to be cancelled?

context: The Navy was modernized in <a0_0>the <b5_0>1880s<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and by the 1890s had adopted the naval power strategy of Captain Alfred Thayer Mahan—as indeed did every major navy. The old sailing ships were replaced by <a1_0><b6_0>modern steel battleships<b6_0/><a1_0/>, bringing them in line with the navies of Britain and Germany. In 1907, most of the Navy's battleships, with several support vessels, dubbed <a2_0>the <b7_0>Great White Fleet<b7_0/><a2_0/>, were featured in a 14-month circumnavigation of the world. Ordered by <a3_0><b8_0>President Theodore Roosevelt<b8_0/><a3_0/>, it was a mission designed <a4_0>to <b9_0>demonstrate the Navy's capability to extend to the global theater<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
